summary: A do-until-statement is a loop that iterates until a postcondition becomes true.
details: The body will be executed at least once.
The condition will be unboxed, if necessary.
The body of a loop can contain break-statements.
The body of a loop can contain continue-statements.
The body of a loop can contain redo-statements.
checks: The type of condition must be assignable to type boolean.
example-1: module Main in examples;%0A%0A@Start%0Adefun main (args : String[]) : void%0A{%0A    var i = 0;%0A    %0A    do%0A    {%0A        (F::println %22i = %22 .. i);%0A%0A        i = i + 1;%0A    }%0A    until (i == 5)%0A}
